column4: question: from Gnome's hig guide point of view. What do you think of when hovering the mouse over the menu's Applications and Computer that the menu's should highlight up?
It's sometimes a good idea.
But I don't know what the Gnome HIG has to say about that.
For Ubuntu's main button theme?
I guess, but what do you have in mind? Brown highlighting of white?
Well, if you use a different theme there's highlighting.
I guess you could ask
The "Button"
C is probably best, and most frustrating, python is more fun.
best in what way? I mean for a desktop application raw speed is not the most important feature is it?
With C you have the most up-to-date gtk libs.
But my friend made a great MusicPlayer (Called Quod Libet) in just a weekend using Python.
python has sorting classes like the stl of C++?
Not sure, I'm just a python newbie, I took it up over the weekend to make a program called PyFolder.
The only thing about C is you have to learn the C way of object oriented programming.
and Aan234: You just need the correct settings in /etc/fstab
killall name_of_app
